definition: important official or statesman (in feudal China)
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131
surname Chen

sentences.english: Zhang Boxing was famous Official of Neo-Confucianism in Kangxi Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 張伯行是康熙朝的理學名臣。

sentences.english: East Fen River in the east coast, Ming Chen Li, deputy Zhenguan presided over the building.
sentences.chinese: 東城在汾河東岸，爲貞觀名臣李副主持修築。

definition: sagacious prime minister (in feudal China)
famous prime minister (in ancient China)/names and appearances (Buddhism)
outstanding founding minister (title given to reward loyal general or vassal of new dynasty or state)
important minister/major figure in government
faithful official
prime minister (in feudal China)
high official
founding figure (of a country or dynasty)/founding father/fig. also used of company or school etc
famous scholar/worthy/celebrity, esp. distinguished literary person having no official post
to have reached the highest official positions
a treacherous court official/a minister who conspires against the state

official who dares speak frankly before the emperor
